title: Richest oil states should pay climate tax, says Gordon Brown
titleCN: 戈登·布朗表示，最富有的石油国家应支付气候税

paragraphs.original: The world's richest oil states pay a global windfall tax to help poorer nations combat climate change, ex-PM Gordon Brown has said.
paragraphs.translation: 英国前首相戈登·布朗表示，全球最富有的石油国家应支付一笔全球暴利税，以帮助较贫穷国家应对气候变化。

paragraphs.original: He said countries such as Saudi Arabia, the UAE, Qatar and Norway benefited from a lottery style bonanza last year, as the price of oil soared.
paragraphs.translation: 他表示，随着油价飙升，沙特阿拉伯、阿联酋、卡塔尔和挪威等国家去年从类似彩票式的暴利中获益。

paragraphs.original: Mr Brown argues a $25bn (&20.4bn) levy should boost prospects of a deal on a climate fund for poorer countries.
paragraphs.translation: 布朗认为，征收250亿美元（约合204亿英镑）的税款将有望推动为较贫穷国家设立气候基金的协议达成。

paragraphs.original: His *intervention*(干预) comes ahead of the COP28 summit in Dubai in November. Speaking at last week's Climate Ambition Summit at the United Nations in New York, Secretary General Antonio Guterres warned that world leaders were coming up abysmally short in their efforts to curb carbon emissions.
paragraphs.translation: 他的此番干预正值11月迪拜COP28峰会召开前夕。联合国秘书长安东尼奥·古特雷斯上周在纽约联合国气候雄心峰会上警告称，世界各国领导人在减少碳排放方面的努力严重不足。

paragraphs.original: He called for the world's biggest emitters to agree a climate solidarity pact to reduce emissions and support emerging economies.
paragraphs.translation: 他呼吁全球最大的碳排放国达成一项气候团结协定，以减少排放并支持新兴经济体。

paragraphs.original: UK skips leaders' statement on climate action
paragraphs.translation: 英国未签署领导人气候行动声明

paragraphs.original: US refuses climate reparations for developing nations
paragraphs.translation: 美国拒绝向发展中国家提供气候赔偿

paragraphs.original: Why has an oil boss been chosen to head COP28?
paragraphs.translation: 为何选择一位石油巨头负责人来主持COP28？

paragraphs.original: Mr Brown said his plan would prevent a stalemate and potential breakdown at COP28 in the United Arab Emirates(UAE) - one of the richest oil producers identified.
paragraphs.translation: 布朗表示，他的计划将避免在阿联酋（被列为最富有的石油生产国之一）举行的COP28峰会陷入僵局和潜在的破裂。

paragraphs.original: He said "petro-states" had recorded almost unimaginable profits from the rise in oil price in recent years, with the five richest - which also include Kuwait - doubling their oil revenues in 2022.
paragraphs.translation: 他表示，"石油国家"近年来从油价上涨中获得了几乎难以想象的利润，其中最富有的五个国家（包括科威特在内）的石油收入在2022年翻了一番。

paragraphs.original: Quoting figures from the International Energy Agency(IEA), he said global oil and gas revenues had soared from 1.5tn(&1.2tn) before the Covid pandemic to an unprecedented 4tn(&3.3tn).
paragraphs.translation: 他引用国际能源署的数据称，全球石油和天然气收入已从新冠疫情前的1.5万亿美元（约合1.2万亿英镑）飙升至前所未有的4万亿美元（约合3.3万亿英镑）。

paragraphs.original: To put these extraordinary figure into context, $4tn is 20 times the entire global aid budget. It is an income so big that it exceeds the entire GDP of the United Kingdom, he said.
paragraphs.translation: 为理解这一惊人数字，4万亿美元是全球援助预算总额的20倍。这笔收入如此巨大，甚至超过了英国的全部国内生产总值。

paragraphs.original: These producer states have done literally nothing to earn this unprecedented windfall. It represents one of the biggest ever transfers of wealth from poor to rich nations.
paragraphs.translation: 这些石油生产国实际上没有付出任何努力就获得了这笔前所未有的横财。这代表了有史以来最大规模的财富从穷国向富国的转移之一。

paragraphs.original: Mr Brown added the high price of oil and gas had been the main factor in potentially pushing an additional 141 million people around the world into extreme poverty, which is the high range of an estimate from a scientific study carried out earlier this year.
paragraphs.translation: 布朗补充说，高昂的油气价格是可能将全球另外1.41亿人推入极端贫困的主要因素，这是今年早些时候一项科学研究给出的估值上限。

paragraphs.original: He called for the wealthiest oil states to contribute 3% of their export earnings - equivalent to a total of $25bn(&20.4bn in 2022, saying "it is the very least they could do.
paragraphs.translation: 他呼吁最富有的石油国家贡献其出口收入的3%——相当于2022年总额250亿美元（约合204亿英镑），并称"这是他们最起码应该做的"。

paragraphs.original: The former prime minister - a UN envoy for global education and World Health Organisation ambassador for global health financing - said the consequences of such a grand would be immense.
paragraphs.translation: 这位前首相——现任联合国全球教育特使和世界卫生组织全球卫生筹资大使——表示，这样一笔巨额资金将产生巨大影响。

paragraphs.original: We would be giving crisis-torn countries what has been absent in recent summits: hope. he said.
paragraphs.translation: 他说："我们将为饱受危机困扰的国家带来近期峰会所缺乏的东西：希望。"

title: South Africa: Healthy Eating and Non-Communicable Disease Prevention
titleCN: 南非：健康饮食与非传染性疾病预防

paragraphs.original: The food we eat has a large impact on our health. An unhealthy diet typically high in sugar, saturated fat, and salt and low in vegetables and fruits, can contribute to the development of non-communicable diseases. Examples of NCDs are diabetes, hypertension, heart disease and cancer. There are highly prevalent in South Africa and as a disease group, have become the largest killer in the country.
paragraphs.translation: 我们吃的食物对健康影响很大。不健康的饮食通常糖分、饱和脂肪和盐含量高，而蔬菜水果含量低，会促进非传染性疾病的发生。非传染性疾病包括糖尿病、高血压、心脏病和癌症等。这些疾病在南非非常普遍，作为一类疾病，已成为该国最大的“杀手”。

paragraphs.original: One of things you can do to reduce the risk of developing NCDs is to eat a nutritious diet, ensuring that you include enough vegetables and fruits. The more processed the foods are in your diet, the farther away they are from their natural state and are more likely to contain added ingredients that in the long run may be harmful to your health.
paragraphs.translation: 降低非传染性疾病风险的方法之一，是保持营养均衡的饮食，确保摄入足够的蔬菜水果。饮食中加工食品越多，它们离天然状态越远，也越可能含有添加成分，从长远来看可能对健康有害。

paragraphs.original: Eating healthy as a young person can be challenging. Some young advocates at UNICEF's youth advocacy trainings expressed they they often skip breakfast and rely on cheap, fatty takeaways as a convenient option to keep them going thorughout the day. There is also the perception that healthy foods are mroe expensive, and cooking healthy meals takes too much time. It's time to change this narrative and make healthy choices and a healthy diet more affordable and accessible for young people.
paragraphs.translation: 对年轻人来说，吃得健康并不容易。在联合国儿童基金会的青年倡导培训中，一些青年倡导者表示，他们经常不吃早餐，依赖便宜、高脂肪的外卖来“撑过一天”。还有一种看法是：健康食品更贵，而且做健康餐很花时间。现在是时候改变这种观念，让健康选择和健康饮食对年轻人来说更经济、更容易获得。

paragraphs.original: Other ways to prevents NCDs are being physically active and limiting your intake of alcohol and tobacco. check out the South African Food-Based Dietary Guildlines for helpful tips and suggestions on having a healthier diet. This version is easy-to-digest!
paragraphs.translation: 预防非传染性疾病的其他方法包括坚持身体活动，以及限制烟酒摄入。可以参考《南非食物类膳食指南》，里面有很多实用的健康饮食建议，内容通俗易懂。

paragraphs.original: Also remember that there are different sources of protein, these includes those from animals and plant-based. Lean animal-based foods such as eggs, fish, chickens and lean cuts beef are great sources of good quality protein. Plant-based food like pulses and legumes are cost-effective and great sources of quality protein. Add these foods to your diet to help your body to grow and develop in a healthy way.
paragraphs.translation: 还要记住，蛋白质来源有很多，包括动物性和植物性。鸡蛋、鱼、鸡肉和瘦牛肉等瘦肉类是优质蛋白的良好来源；豆类等植物性食物性价比高，也是优质蛋白的重要来源。把这些食物加入你的日常饮食，有助于身体健康成长和发育。

paragraphs.original: Some other tips include checking the nutritional label to know what you are eating. Whenever possible, cook your own meals so you know exactly what goes into your food. We encourage your to learn to cook more nutritious meals that are not only delicious, but also fun to prepare and affordable. Here are a few ideas from Western Cape department of Health.
paragraphs.translation: 其他建议还包括查看营养标签，了解自己吃进去的是什么。尽量自己做饭，这样你能清楚知道食物里放了什么。我们鼓励你学习制作更有营养的饭菜，它们不仅美味，而且做起来有趣、价格也实惠。以下是西开普省卫生厅提供的一些建议。

title: Best apples to eat? Healthiest types from green to red and everything in between
titleCN: 吃哪种苹果最好？从青到红，各种颜色中最健康的品种

paragraphs.original: Apples are a classic fruit choice. They're the unofficial mascot of lunchbox side dishes and they make a delicious afternoon snack when dipped in peanut butter. They're even available at McDonald's as a healthy Happy Meal side.
paragraphs.translation: 苹果是一种经典的水果选择。它们是午餐盒配菜的“非官方吉祥物”，蘸上花生酱后更是美味的下午茶点。你甚至可以在麦当劳买到它们，作为开心的健康配菜。

paragraphs.original: It's no surprise then that the U.S is one of the world's largest apple producer, second only to China. We produce an average of 240 million bushels of apples every year, according to the U.S. Apple Association.
paragraphs.translation: 因此，美国是世界上最大的苹果生产国之一，仅次于中国，也就不足为奇了。根据美国苹果协会的数据，我们平均每年生产2.4亿蒲式耳的苹果。

paragraphs.original: But with so many varieties to choose from, is there one that reigns supreme? Here's what we found out about the nutritional profiles of the different kinds of apples.
paragraphs.translation: 但是，面对如此多可供选择的品种，是否有一种是“王者”呢？以下是我们对不同种类苹果营养成分的调查结果。

paragraphs.original: What is the healthiest apple?
paragraphs.translation: 哪种苹果最健康？

paragraphs.original: Whether it's Granny Smith, Gloden Delicious, Honeycrisp or Gala; any type of apple is going to benefit your health. Only 12.3% of Americian adults meet their fruit intake recommondations, the Center for Disease Control and Prevention found. The more apples in your diet, the better, says registered dietitian Danielle Crumble Smith, regardless of the type. Some, however have unique health benefits.
paragraphs.translation: 无论是澳洲青苹（Granny Smith）、金帅（Golden Delicious）、蜜脆（Honeycrisp）还是嘎啦果（Gala），任何种类的苹果都对你的健康有益。美国疾病控制与预防中心发现，只有12.3%的美国成年人达到了建议的水果摄入量。注册营养师丹妮尔·克伦布尔·史密斯（Danielle Crumble Smith）表示，无论哪种类型，饮食中的苹果越多越好。不过，有些品种确实具有独特的健康益处。

paragraphs.original: Red Delicious apples are the healthiest from an antioxidant standpoint, Crumble Smith says. The darker the color of the apple, the richer it'll be in antioxidants. Antioxidants help neutralize the free radicals in our bodies which, when imbalanced, can cause cell damage and lead to disease.
paragraphs.translation: 克伦布尔·史密斯说，从抗氧化剂的角度来看，红蛇果（Red Delicious）是最健康的。苹果的颜色越深，其抗氧化剂含量就越丰富。抗氧化剂有助于中和我们体内的自由基，当自由基失衡时，会导致细胞损伤并引发疾病。

paragraphs.original: Aiming for different types of deep colors can help you ensure you're getting variety of different types of antioxidants, she says.
paragraphs.translation: 她说，目标是不同种类的深色苹果，可以帮助你确保摄入多种不同类型的抗氧化剂。

paragraphs.original: If you're looking to increase your vitamin C intake, try a Pink Lady or McIntosh apple, Crumble Smith says, If fiber is what your seek, go for a Honeycrisp or Granny Smith.
paragraphs.translation: 克伦布尔·史密斯说，如果你想增加维生素C的摄入量，可以尝试粉红佳人（Pink Lady）或麦金托什（McIntosh）苹果；如果你寻求的是纤维，那就选择蜜脆（Honeycrisp）或澳洲青苹（Granny Smith）。

paragraphs.original: Across the board with apples one thing's for sure, Crumble Smith, eat them raw and unpeeled.
paragraphs.translation: 关于苹果，有一件事是肯定的，克伦布尔·史密斯说：要生吃，而且不要削皮。

paragraphs.original: Eating the skin ensures that you're really going to eat all of that fiber, get all of those antioxidants because the skin is where a lot of it is, Crumble Smith says. The vitamin C content can also decrease during the cooking process because vitamin C is soluable in water and sensitive to temperature.
paragraphs.translation: 克伦布尔·史密斯说，吃果皮可以确保你摄入全部的纤维和所有的抗氧化剂，因为果皮中含有大量的这些成分。此外，在烹饪过程中，维生素C的含量也会下降，因为维生素C溶于水且对温度敏感。

paragraphs.original: Are apples healthy?
paragraphs.translation: 苹果健康吗？

paragraphs.original: Yes - apples are packed with vitamins and minerals and are an important part of a healthy diet, just like other fruits. They're a good source of fiber and contain pectin, a fiber that acts as a prebiotic to aid colon function and digestion.
paragraphs.translation: 是的——苹果富含维生素和矿物质，就像其他水果一样，是健康饮食的重要组成部分。它们是良好的纤维来源，并含有果胶，这种纤维作为一种益生元，有助于结肠功能和消化。

paragraphs.original: Apples are high in vitamin C, which has antioxidant properties to help us absorb and store iron, maintain strong tissues, boost our immune system and produce more collagen for hair, skin and nail health.
paragraphs.translation: 苹果富含维生素C，维生素C具有抗氧化特性，有助于我们吸收和储存铁，维持强壮的组织，增强免疫系统，并产生更多胶原蛋白，促进头发、皮肤和指甲的健康。

paragraphs.original: Apples also contain quercetin, a flavonoid with antioxidant properties that studies show may reduce the risk of cardiovascular disease and protect against allergies because it acts as a natural antihistamine.
paragraphs.translation: 苹果还含有槲皮素（quercetin），这是一种具有抗氧化特性的类黄酮。研究表明，它可能降低心血管疾病的风险，并预防过敏，因为它起到了天然抗组胺药的作用。

paragraphs.original: Apple cider vinegar, a fermented solution made from pressed apples, also has numerous health benefits including weight loss and cholesterol management.
paragraphs.translation: 苹果醋是一种由压榨苹果制成的发酵溶液，也具有许多健康益处，包括减肥和胆固醇管理。

paragraphs.original: Apples are listed on the Dirty Dozen list, or the environmental working group's analysis of the 12 vegetables with the highest traces of pesticides.
paragraphs.translation: 苹果被列入了“脏十二种”名单（Dirty Dozen list），即环境工作组（Environmental Working Group）分析出的农药残留量最高的12种蔬菜（和水果）之一。

paragraphs.original: This doesn't means you shouldn't eat them. Crumble Smith says. Buying organic is one option if you're eating apples daily. Still, organic produce is not completely pesticide-free because farmers often use naturally-derived pesticides derived. Research published in the Journal of Toxicology found the pesticides in the produce on the Dirty Dozen list are at negligible levels and substituting organic didn't result in significant risk reduction.
paragraphs.translation: 克伦布尔·史密斯说，这并不意味着你不应该吃它们。如果你每天都吃苹果，购买有机苹果是一个选择。不过，有机农产品并非完全没有农药，因为农民经常使用天然衍生的农药。发表在《毒理学杂志》（Journal of Toxicology）上的研究发现，“脏十二种”名单上农产品中的农药含量可以忽略不计，用有机产品替代并不会显著降低风险。

title: China's BYD overtakes Tesla's electric car sales in the last quarter of 2023
titleCN: 中国比亚迪在2023年第四季度的电动汽车销量超过特斯拉

paragraphs.original: Chinese company BYD sold more electric vehicles than Elon Musk's Tesla in the last three months of 2023 as the two battled for top spot in the sector.
paragraphs.translation: 2023年最后三个月，中国企业比亚迪售出的电动汽车数量超过了埃隆·马斯克旗下的特斯拉，两家公司正在争夺该领域的头把交椅。

paragraphs.original: BYD said on Monday it had sold a record 526,000 battery-only vehicles in the final quarter of 2023.
paragraphs.translation: 比亚迪周一表示，其在2023年第四季度售出了创纪录的52.6万辆纯电动汽车。

paragraphs.original: It marked the first quarter its battery-only sales have outpaced Tesla's. The US-based firm has seen demand slow as borrowing costs climb.
paragraphs.translation: 这是比亚迪纯电动汽车销量首次在单季度超过特斯拉。随着借贷成本上升，这家美国企业的需求出现放缓。

paragraphs.original: However, for the whole of 2023, Mr Musk's Tesla still sold more.
paragraphs.translation: 不过，就2023年全年而言，马斯克的特斯拉销量仍更高。

paragraphs.original: On Tuesday, Tesla said it delivered a record 484,500 electric vehicles in the last three months of 2023 and 1.8 million for the year as a whole.
paragraphs.translation: 特斯拉周二称，其2023年最后三个月交付了创纪录的48.45万辆电动汽车，全年交付量达180万辆。

paragraphs.original: The end-of-year performance was better than analysts had expected, as sales rose 20% from the same period in 2022 and picked up pace from earlier in 2023. Analyst Dan Ives of Wedbush Securities described the quarter as a "clear win" for Tesla.
paragraphs.translation: 年终表现好于分析师预期：销量较2022年同期增长20%，且较2023年初有所提速。韦德布什证券公司分析师丹·艾夫斯称，该季度对特斯拉而言是“明确的胜利”。

paragraphs.original: But it fell short of earlier hopes. Last January, Mr Musk said that Tesla had the potential to achieve two million deliveries in 2023.
paragraphs.translation: 但这仍未达到此前的预期。去年1月，马斯克曾表示，特斯拉2023年有望实现200万辆的交付量。

paragraphs.original: The firm cut prices repeatedly to try to woo buyers.
paragraphs.translation: 该公司多次降价以吸引消费者。

paragraphs.original: "As BYD has accelerated into the fast lane, it's fresh evidence of just how competitive the EV market has become and how hard it will be for Tesla to swerve back to head the pack," said Susannah Streeter, head of money and markets at Hargreaves Lansdown.
paragraphs.translation: “随着比亚迪驶入快车道，这再次证明电动汽车市场的竞争已变得多么激烈，而特斯拉要重新领跑将多么困难，”哈格里夫斯·兰斯当公司货币与市场部门负责人苏珊娜·斯特里特表示。

paragraphs.original: For the year as a whole, Shenzen-based BYD sold more than 3 million so-called-new energy vehicles (NEVs), which includes battery-only vehicles and hybrids.
paragraphs.translation: 就全年而言，总部位于深圳的比亚迪售出了超300万辆所谓的新能源汽车（包括纯电动汽车和混合动力汽车）。

paragraphs.original: Almost 1.6 million of its total sales were battery-only vehicles, the firm said.
paragraphs.translation: 该公司称，其总销量中近160万辆是纯电动汽车。

paragraphs.original: BYD's chief executive Wang Chuanfu co-founded BYD with his cousin in Shenzhen in 1995.
paragraphs.translation: 比亚迪首席执行官王传福于1995年与表兄在深圳共同创立了比亚迪。

paragraphs.original: The company made a name for itself as a manufacturer of rechargeable batteries - used in smartphones, laptops and other electronics - that competed with pricier Japanese imports.
paragraphs.translation: 该公司最初以可充电电池制造商的身份崭露头角（其电池用于智能手机、笔记本电脑等电子产品），与价格更高的日本进口电池展开竞争。

paragraphs.original: It started selling its shares on the stock market in 2002 and diversified by purchasing a struggling state-owned car manufacturer, Qinchuan Automobile Company.
paragraphs.translation: 比亚迪于2002年开始在股市上市，并通过收购陷入困境的国有汽车制造商秦川汽车公司实现业务多元化。

paragraphs.original: Since 2008 BYD has counted veteran US investor Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway as a shareholder.
paragraphs.translation: 自2008年起，比亚迪就将美国资深投资者沃伦·巴菲特旗下的伯克希尔·哈撒韦公司列为股东。

paragraphs.original: Analysts say BYD owes its growth to its original business - batteries. They are among the most expensive parts of an EV and making them in-house saves BYD a lot of money.
paragraphs.translation: 分析师表示，比亚迪的增长得益于其原本的电池业务。电池是电动汽车成本最高的部件之一，自研电池为比亚迪节省了大量成本。

paragraphs.original: Many of BYD's competitors rely on third-party manufacturers for batteries.
paragraphs.translation: 比亚迪的许多竞争对手依赖第三方制造商供应电池。

paragraphs.original: BYD's battery business helped to give it flexibility to cut prices sharply at the end of 2023, lifting sales, which jumped by 70% in December alone.
paragraphs.translation: 比亚迪的电池业务使其在2023年底具备大幅降价的灵活性，从而拉动了销量——仅12月销量就激增了70%。
